progress_bar.title: Progress Bar
progress_bar.desc: The progress bar is used to visually represent the completion of a both determinate and indeterminate task. It is used to  show how much of the task has been completed and how much is  left.

badge.title: Badge
badge.desc: Badges convey dynamic, temporary information, such as counts or status. A badge can include labels or numbers.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.desc: Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.desc: Avatars are visual representations of users that leverage images, icons, or text. They also can contain a presence indicator which shows the userâ€™s status on the product.

ðŸŸ _select.title: ðŸŸ  Select
ðŸŸ _select.desc: Selects present a list of options from which a user can select one option, or several. A selected option can represent a value in a form, or can be used as an action to filter or sort existing content.

ðŸŸ _search.title: ðŸŸ  Search
ðŸŸ _search.desc: Search offers users a way to explore a website or application using keywords. Search can be used as the primary means of discovering content or as a filter to aid the user in finding content.

ax_guideline.title: AX Guideline
ax_guideline.desc: Accessibility is the inclusive practice of ensuring that everyone has equal access to information, functionality, and experiences.

grid_&_layout.title: Grid & Layout
grid_&_layout.desc: The Grid is an overarching guide to the placement of components and elements. Aligning to the grid ensures consistency, visual balance and rhythm.

illustration_guideline.title: Illustration Guideline
illustration_guideline.desc: We simplify complex ideas with our unique illustrations, making them universally clear and memorable, while allowing our brand personality to evolve unexpectedly.
